section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used inNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 278.0103to278.0195, inclusive, have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Aboveground utilityï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Aboveground utilityï¿½ means an aboveground electric transmission line which is designed to operate at 200 kilovolts or more and which has been approved for construction after October 1, 1991, by the State or Federal Government or a governing body.

section.heading: ï¿½Affordable housingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Affordable housingï¿½ means tier one affordable housing, tier two affordable housing or tier three affordable housing.

section.heading: ï¿½Average residential densityï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Average residential densityï¿½ means the number of lots intended for residential dwelling units within the boundaries of a subdivided or developed area, divided by the total number of acres within the boundaries of the subdivision or developed area.

section.heading: ï¿½Building codeï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Building codeï¿½ means ordinances, plans, regulations or rulings adopted by the governing body for the purpose of regulating and specifying the soundness of construction of structures.

section.heading: ï¿½Building officialï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Building officialï¿½ means a person employed by a city or county who is charged with the administration and enforcement of building codes. The term includes a person appointed to fill the position of building official pursuant toNRS 278.570and an administrative official of the city or county who is authorized by the city or county to assume the functions of the position of building official pursuant toNRS 278.570.

section.heading: ï¿½Cities and countiesï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Cities and countiesï¿½ means all counties and cities located in counties. Carson City is considered as a county.

section.heading: ï¿½City surveyorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½City surveyorï¿½ means a person appointed as such or a person designated by a city council or other legislative body of the city to perform the duties of a city surveyor pursuant to this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Commissionï¿½ and ï¿½planning commissionï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Commissionï¿½ or ï¿½planning commissionï¿½ means the planning commission of the city, the county or the region, as established by ordinance or by the provisions of this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Common-interest communityï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Common-interest communityï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 116.021.

section.heading: ï¿½County surveyorï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½County surveyorï¿½ means a person appointed as such or a person designated by a board of county commissioners or the Board of Supervisors of Carson City to perform the duties of a county surveyor pursuant to this chapter.

section.heading: ï¿½Final mapï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Final mapï¿½ means a map prepared in accordance with the provisions ofNRS 278.325,278.360to278.460, inclusive,278.472,278.4725or278.4955and any applicable local ordinance, which is designed to be placed on record in the office of the county recorder of the county in which any part of the subdivision is located or the recorder of Carson City.

section.heading: ï¿½Gaming enterprise districtï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Gaming enterprise districtï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 463.0158.

section.heading: ï¿½Governing bodyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Governing bodyï¿½ means the city council or other legislative body of the city or the board of county commissioners or, in the case of Carson City, the Board of Supervisors.

section.heading: ï¿½Historic neighborhoodï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Historic neighborhoodï¿½ means an area designated as a historic neighborhood pursuant toNRS 278.02076.

section.heading: ï¿½Improvementï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Improvementï¿½ means such street work and utilities to be installed on land dedicated or to be dedicated for streets and easements as are necessary for local drainage, local traffic and the general use of property owners in the subdivision.

section.heading: ï¿½Infrastructureï¿½ and ï¿½public facilitiesï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Infrastructureï¿½ or ï¿½public facilitiesï¿½ means facilities and the structure or network used for the delivery of goods, services and public safety. The term includes, without limitation, communications facilities, facilities for the transmission and distribution of electricity and natural gas, water systems, sanitary sewer systems, storm sewer systems, streets and roads, traffic control systems, sidewalks, parks and trails, recreational facilities, fire, police and flood protection and all related appurtenances, equipment and employee costs.

section.heading: ï¿½Local ordinanceï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Local ordinanceï¿½ means an ordinance enacted by the governing body of any city or county, pursuant to the powers granted inNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive.

section.heading: ï¿½Lotï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Lotï¿½ means a distinct part or parcel of land which has been divided to transfer ownership or to build. The term does not include a parcel of land used or intended solely for use as a location for a water well.

section.heading: ï¿½Military installationï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Military installationï¿½ means a base or facility at which or from which the Air Force, Army, Coast Guard, Marine Corps, Navy, Air Force Reserve, Army Reserve, Coast Guard Reserve, Marine Corps Reserve, Navy Reserve or National Guard conducts exercises, maneuvers, operations, patrols or training.

section.heading: ï¿½Mobile home parkï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Mobile home parkï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to ï¿½manufactured home parkï¿½ inNRS 118B.017.

section.heading: ï¿½Parcel mapï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Parcel mapï¿½ means a map as provided inNRS 278.461,278.462,278.463,278.464or278.466.

section.heading: ï¿½Regional planning coalitionï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Regional planning coalitionï¿½ means the regional planning coalition described inNRS 278.02514.

section.heading: ï¿½Renewable energyï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Renewable energyï¿½ means a source of energy that occurs naturally or is regenerated naturally, including, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Biomass; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Fuel cells; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Geothermal energy; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Solar energy; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Waterpower; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Wind. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The term does not include coal, natural gas, oil, propane or any other fossil fuel, or nuclear energy.

section.heading: ï¿½Renewable energy generation projectï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Renewable energy generation projectï¿½ means a project involving an electric generating facility or system that uses renewable energy as its primary source of energy to generate electricity. The term does not include a project involving an electric generating facility or system that uses nuclear energy, in whole or in part, to generate electricity.

section.heading: ï¿½Residential dwelling unitï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Residential dwelling unitï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 278.4977.

section.heading: ï¿½Right-of-wayï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Right-of-wayï¿½ includes all public and private rights-of-way and all areas required for public use in accordance with any master plan or parts thereof.

section.heading: ï¿½Rural preservation neighborhoodï¿½ defined.

content.p: Where the outer boundary of each lot that is used for residential purposes is not more than 330 feet from the outer boundary of any other lot that is used for residential purposes; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Which has no more than two residential dwelling units per acre; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Which allows residents to raise or keep animals noncommercially.

section.heading: ï¿½Streetsï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Streetsï¿½ includes streets, avenues, boulevards, roads, lanes, alleys, viaducts, public easements and rights-of-way, and other ways.

section.heading: ï¿½Subdividerï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Subdividerï¿½ means a person or governmental entity which causes land to be divided into a subdivision for that person or governmental entity or for others.

section.heading: ï¿½Tentative mapï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Tentative mapï¿½ means a map made to show the design of a proposed subdivision and the existing conditions in and around it.

section.heading: ï¿½Tier one affordable housingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Tier one affordable housingï¿½ means housing for a household: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Which has a total monthly gross income that is equal to not more than 60 percent of the median monthly gross household income for the county in which the housing is located; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Which costs not more than 30 percent of the total monthly gross household income of a household whose income equals 60 percent of the median monthly gross household income for the county in which the housing is located, including the cost of utilities. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For purposes of this section, median gross household income must be determined based upon the estimates of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development of the most current median gross family income for the county in which the housing is located.

section.heading: ï¿½Tier three affordable housingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Tier three affordable housingï¿½ means housing for a household: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Which has a total monthly gross income that is equal to more than 80 percent but not more than 120 percent of the median monthly gross household income for the county in which the housing is located; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Which costs not more than 30 percent of the total monthly gross household income of a household whose income equals 120 percent of the median monthly gross household income for the county in which the housing is located, including the cost of utilities. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For purposes of this section, median gross household income must be determined based upon the estimates of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development of the most current median gross family income for the county in which the housing is located.

section.heading: ï¿½Tier two affordable housingï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Tier two affordable housingï¿½ means housing for a household: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Which has a total monthly gross income that is equal to more than 60 percent but not more than 80 percent of the median monthly gross household income for the county in which the housing is located; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Which costs not more than 30 percent of the total monthly gross household income of a household whose income equals 80 percent of the median monthly gross household income for the county in which the housing is located, including the cost of utilities. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For purposes of this section, median gross household income must be determined based upon the estimates of the United States Department of Housing and Urban Development of the most current median gross family income for the county in which the housing is located.

section.heading: ï¿½Undeveloped landï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Undeveloped landï¿½ means land in its unused, natural or reclaimed state and on which little or no infrastructure exists.

section.heading: ï¿½Used for residential purposesï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Used for residential purposesï¿½ means a lot or parcel of land that is 5 acres or less in area and contains a residential dwelling unit of a permanent nature.

section.heading: ï¿½Utility projectï¿½ defined.

content.p: An electric transmission line which is designed to operate at 200 kilovolts or more; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A line used to transport natural gas which operates at 20 percent or more of the specified minimum yield strength of the material from which the line is constructed, ï¿½which has been approved for construction after October 1, 1991, by the State or Federal Government or a governing body.

section.heading: Regulation by governing bodies of improvement of land and location of structures for general welfare.

content.p: For the purpose of promoting health, safety, morals, or the general welfare of the community, the governing bodies of cities and counties are authorized and empowered to regulate and restrict the improvement of land and to control the location and soundness of structures. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any such regulation, restriction and control must take into account: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The potential impairment of natural resources and the total population which the available natural resources will support without unreasonable impairment; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The availability of and need for affordable housing in the community, including affordable housing that is accessible to persons with disabilities.

In the manner prescribed by ordinance, a governing body may, upon application of any person having a legal or equitable interest in land, enter into an agreement with that person concerning the development of that land. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An agreement entered into pursuant to this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Must contain provisions: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Specifying what events will constitute breach of the agreement; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Providing periods during which any breach may be cured; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
May contain provisions specifying or relating to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The permitted uses of the land; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The phasing or timing of construction or development on the land, including, without limitation, the dates on which all or any part of the construction or development must commence and be completed, and the terms on which any deadline may be extended; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The conditions, terms, restrictions and requirements for infrastructure on the land and the financing of the public infrastructure by a person having a legal or equitable interest in the land; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The conditions, terms, restrictions and requirements for annexation of land by the city or county and the phasing or timing of annexation by the city or county; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The conditions, terms, restrictions and requirements relating to the intent of the governing body to include the land in an improvement district created pursuant tochapter 271of NRS; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A schedule of fees and charges; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other matters relating to the development of the land. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Unless the agreement otherwise provides and except as otherwise provided in subsection 4, the ordinances, resolutions or regulations applicable to that land and governing the permitted uses of that land, density and standards for design, improvements and construction are those in effect at the time the agreement is made. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

This section does not prohibit the governing body from adopting new ordinances, resolutions or regulations applicable to that land which do not conflict with those ordinances, resolutions and regulations in effect at the time the agreement is made, except that any subsequent action by the governing body must not prevent the development of the land as set forth in the agreement. The governing body is not prohibited from denying or conditionally approving any other plan for development pursuant to any ordinance, resolution or regulation in effect at the time of that denial or approval.

section.heading: Agreement with governing body concerning development of land: Approval by ordinance; recording.

content.p: The governing body may, if it finds that the provisions of the agreement are consistent with the master plan, approve the agreement by ordinance. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Within a reasonable time after approval of the agreement, the clerk of the governing body shall cause the original agreement to be recorded with the county recorder or the recorder of Carson City. Upon recordation, the agreement binds all parties and their successors in interest for the duration of the agreement.

section.heading: Agreement with governing body concerning development of land: Amendment or cancellation; review of development by governing body; notice; approval of amendment; filing and recording of notice of cancellation or amendment.

content.p: An agreement for development of land entered into pursuant toNRS 278.0201may be amended or cancelled, in whole or in part, by: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Mutual consent of the parties to the agreement or their successors in interest; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Subject to the requirements of this section andNRS 278.02053, the governing body without the consent of the other parties to the agreement or their successors in interest, if the governing body determines, upon a review of the development of the land held at least once every 24 months, that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A party to the agreement or a successor in interest is in breach of any of the terms or conditions of the agreement and: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (I) Any applicable period set forth in the agreement for curing the breach has passed; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (II) If the agreement does not contain an applicable period for curing the breach, the governing body has provided the party in breach with notice that the party is in breach and has provided the party not less than 30 days to cure the breach; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any event has occurred which demonstrates that a party to the agreement or a successor in interest is unable to perform his or her duties set forth in the agreement, including, without limitation, the insolvency or bankruptcy of the party or his or her successor in interest, the appointment of a receiver for the party or his or her successor in interest or the commission of fraud by the party or his or her successor in interest. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

In addition to the notice requirement set forth in subsection 1 ofNRS 278.02053, notice of intention to amend or cancel any portion of the agreement must be given by publication in a newspaper of general circulation in the applicable city or county. The governing body may approve cancellation of the agreement by ordinance or approve any amendment to the agreement by ordinance if the amendment is consistent with the master plan. The original of the notice of cancellation or the amendment must be filed for recording with the county recorder or the recorder of Carson City.

section.heading: Agreements with governing body concerning development of land: Public hearing required before unilateral amendment or cancellation by governing body; notice required; waiver of complaint, protest or objection if not timely presented.

content.p: If a governing body makes a determination described in paragraph

of subsection 1 ofNRS 278.0205, before the governing body may amend or cancel an agreement for development of land entered into pursuant toNRS 278.0201without the consent of the other parties to the agreement or their successors in interest, the governing body must hold a public hearing concerning the proposed amendment to or cancellation of the agreement that complies with the provisions of this section. Not less than 60 daysï¿½ notice of the date and time of the public hearing must be given to the parties to the agreement or their successors in interest and any property owner of record that is subject to the agreement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

On the date and at the time and place fixed for the hearing, any person having a legal or equitable interest in the land or any other interested person may give oral or written testimony to the governing body concerning the proposed amendment to or cancellation of the agreement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The governing body shall consider all the testimony presented at the hearing and any other relevant information presented at the hearing and, after the conclusion of the hearing, make a determination concerning whether to amend or cancel the agreement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any complaint, protest or objection to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The effect of the proposed amendment to or cancellation of the agreement on the zoning or entitlements related to the property that is subject to the agreement; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The regularity, validity or correctness of any proceedings relating to or actions taken with respect to the hearing on or before the date of the hearing, ï¿½shall be deemed waived unless presented at the hearing or received in writing by the clerk of the governing body at least 3 business days before the date of the hearing.

section.heading: Agreement with governing body concerning development of land: Recording of certified copy of ordinance adopting agreement.

content.p: A certified copy of any local ordinance adopting the agreement for the development of property and any amendments thereto must be recorded in the office of the county recorder or the recorder of Carson City.

section.heading: Building permit for residential or commercial project: Extension of period of validity when financing is not available and land is leased for renewable energy generation project.

content.p: A director of planning or a governing body may extend the period for which a building permit for a residential or commercial project is valid if the person to whom the permit has been issued: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Applies for an extension before July 1, 2013, subject to any applicable ordinances or regulations adopted by the governing body; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Demonstrates to the satisfaction of the director of planning or governing body that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Financing for the residential or commercial project is not available; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The land will be leased for a renewable energy generation project; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Submits with his or her application for an extension an affidavit showing that due diligence has been used to obtain financing for the residential or commercial project. The affidavit must include, without limitation, evidence that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The project was denied financing by at least two lenders; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The person was unable to issue bonds or other securities to finance the project. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A building permit that is extended pursuant to subsection 1 must not be effective: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For more than 15 years after the original expiration date of the building permit; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the land ceases to be leased for a renewable energy generation project, after the period established by the director of planning or governing body pursuant to subsection 3. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a director of planning or governing body extends the period for which a building permit is valid pursuant to subsection 1, the director of planning or governing body shall establish the maximum duration of the period for which the permit will remain valid if the land is no longer leased for a renewable energy generation project. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If a director of planning or governing body extends the period for which a building permit is valid pursuant to subsection 1: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
No condition may be placed on the permit that was not imposed on the original permit; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Except as otherwise provided in subsection 5, the ordinances, resolutions or regulations applicable to the land and governing the permitted uses of the land, density and standards for design, improvements and construction are those in effect at the time the building permit is issued. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Changes to ordinances, resolutions or regulations that enforce environmental, life or safety standards against parcels of land that the director of planning or governing body determines are similar to the land for which the building permit was issued will apply to the parcel of land for which the permit was issued. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½environmental, life or safety standardsï¿½ includes, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Standards and codes relating to the usage of water; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any specialized or uniform code related to environmental, life or safety standards.

section.heading: Authority to establish urban agriculture zone; conditions and limitations.

content.p: A governing body may, by ordinance, establish an urban agriculture zone within the boundaries of the city or county. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
To establish an urban agriculture zone, the governing body must conduct at least one public hearing on the question of whether to establish the urban agriculture zone. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An ordinance adopted pursuant to this section must not prohibit the use of structures that support agricultural activity, including, without limitation, toolsheds, greenhouses, produce stands and instructional spaces.

section.heading: Authority of governing body to designate historic neighborhood; requirements and procedure for designation of area as historic neighborhood.

content.p: A governing body may designate a historic neighborhood in a county or city for the purpose of promoting the educational, cultural, economic and general welfare of the public through the preservation and protection of sites, buildings, structures and areas of historic interest. To be eligible for designation as a historic neighborhood, an area must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Be subdivided or developed and consist of 10 or more residential dwelling units, of which at least two-thirds of such units must be 40 or more years of age; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Have been identified by the governing body as having a distinctive character or traditional quality that can be distinguished from surrounding areas or new developments in the vicinity. Such a character or quality may include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Representation of an established and familiar visual feature of an area because of its location, design, architecture or singular physical appearance; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Meeting the criteria for eligibility for listing on the State or National Register of Historic Places. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Before designating a historic neighborhood, the governing body shall hold a public hearing. Notice of the time and the place of the hearing, the purpose of the hearing and the boundaries of the proposed historic neighborhood must be posted in a manner that, at a minimum, satisfies the requirements of subsection 4 ofNRS 241.020. At the hearing, any person may appear in support of or in opposition to the establishment of the proposed historic neighborhood. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Within 15 days after the hearing, the governing body shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Designate the historic neighborhood and fix its boundaries; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Determine not to establish the historic neighborhood. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An ordinance under which a historic neighborhood is designated must, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Contain criteria which substantially achieve the preservation and protection of sites, buildings and structures of historic significance to the historic neighborhood; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide for a designated review board with the power to review proposed alterations to buildings and structures within the historic neighborhood. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a historic neighborhood is designated, the governing body may adopt any other ordinances that it determines are in the best interest of the historic neighborhood in accordance with the purposes expressed in subsection 1.

section.heading: Prohibition against prohibiting or unreasonably restricting use of system for obtaining wind energy; exceptions.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A governing body shall not adopt an ordinance, regulation or plan or take any other action that prohibits or unreasonably restricts the owner of real property from using a system for obtaining wind energy on his or her property. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any covenant, restriction or condition contained in a deed, contract or other legal instrument which affects the transfer or sale of, or any other interest in, real property and which prohibits or unreasonably restricts the owner of the property from using a system for obtaining wind energy on his or her property is void and unenforceable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of subsection 1 do not: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Prohibit a reasonable restriction or requirement: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Imposed pursuant to a determination by the Federal Aviation Administration that the installation of the system for obtaining wind energy would create a hazard to air navigation; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Relating to the finish, location, noise, safety or setback of a system for obtaining wind energy; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Preclude a governing body from denying an application for the issuance of a permit or special use permit for the installation of a system for obtaining wind energy if the governing body determines, based on the size, height or configuration of the system, that installation of the system: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Represents a danger to the health, safety or welfare of the public; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is not compatible with the character of the area in which the system is located.

section.heading: Prohibition against prohibiting or unreasonably restricting use of system for obtaining solar energy.

content.p: A governing body shall not adopt an ordinance, regulation or plan or take any other action that prohibits or unreasonably restricts or has the effect of prohibiting or unreasonably restricting the owner of real property from using a system for obtaining solar energy on his or her property. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any covenant, restriction or condition contained in a deed, contract or other legal instrument which affects the transfer or sale of, or any other interest in, real property and which prohibits or unreasonably restricts or has the effect of prohibiting or unreasonably restricting the owner of the property from using a system for obtaining solar energy on his or her property is void and unenforceable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For the purposes of this section, the following shall be deemed to be unreasonable restrictions: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The placing of a restriction or requirement on the use of a system for obtaining solar energy which decreases the efficiency or performance of the system by more than 10 percent of the amount that was originally specified for the system, as determined by the Director of the Office of Energy, and which does not allow for the use of an alternative system at a substantially comparable cost and with substantially comparable efficiency and performance. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The prohibition of a system for obtaining solar energy that uses components painted with black solar glazing.

section.heading: Mandatory consideration of certain standards and guidelines if governing body establishes committee or task force on sustainable energy.

content.p: Performance guidelines for new, remodeled and renovated buildings; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Performance guidelines for retrofit projects, ï¿½including, without limitation, energy consumption, use of potable water, use of water for landscaping purposes and solid waste disposal.

section.heading: Prohibition against restricting right of owner to display United States flag on real property; limitations; recovery of attorneyï¿½s fees and costs in action for enforcement.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A governing body shall not adopt an ordinance, regulation or plan or take any other action that prohibits an owner of real property from engaging in the display of the flag of the United States on his or her property. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any covenant, condition or restriction contained in a deed, contract or other legal instrument which affects the transfer, sale or any other interest in real property that prohibits the owner of the property from engaging in the display of the flag of the United States on his or her property is void and unenforceable. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Apply to the display of the flag of the United States for commercial advertising purposes. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Preclude a governing body from imposing reasonable restrictions as to the time, place and manner of display of the flag of the United States if the governing body determines that such restrictions are necessary to protect the health, safety or welfare of the public. For the purposes of this paragraph, reasonable restrictions as to the time, place and manner of display of the flag of the United States may include, without limitation, reasonable restrictions as to height and setback. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
In any action commenced to enforce the provisions of this section, the prevailing party is entitled to recover reasonable attorneyï¿½s fees and costs. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½display of the flag of the United Statesï¿½ means a flag of the United States that is: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Made of cloth, fabric or paper; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Displayed from a pole or staff or in a window; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Displayed in a manner that is consistent with 4 U.S.C. Chapter 1. ï¿½The term does not include a depiction or emblem of the flag of the United States that is made of balloons, flora, lights, paint, paving materials, roofing, siding or any other similar building, decorative or landscaping component.

A governing body shall not adopt an ordinance, regulation or plan or take any other action that precludes amateur service communications or that in any other manner does not conform to the provisions of 47 C.F.R. ï¿½ 97.15 and the limited preemption entitled ï¿½Amateur Radio Preemption, 101 F.C.C. 2d 952 (1985)ï¿½ as issued by the Federal Communications Commission. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a governing body adopts an ordinance, regulation or plan or takes any other action that regulates the placement, screening or height of a station antenna structure based on health, safety or aesthetic considerations, the ordinance, regulation, plan or action must: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Reasonably accommodate amateur service communications; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Constitute the minimum level of regulation practicable to carry out the legitimate purpose of the governing body. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not apply to any district organized pursuant to federal, state or local law for the purpose of historic or architectural preservation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any ordinance, regulation or plan adopted by or other action taken by a governing body in violation of the provisions of this section is void. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Amateur radio servicesï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it in 47 C.F.R. ï¿½ 97.3. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Amateur service communicationsï¿½ means communications carried out by one or more of the amateur radio services. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Amateur stationï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it in 47 C.F.R. ï¿½ 97.3. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Station antenna structureï¿½ means the antenna that serves an amateur station, including such appurtenances and other structures as may be necessary to support, stabilize, raise, lower or otherwise adjust the antenna.

section.heading: Factory-built housing: Inclusion in definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½; standards for safety and development; installation prohibited under certain circumstances.

content.p: In any ordinance relating to the zoning of land adopted or amended by a governing body, the definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½ must include factory-built housing that has been built in compliance with the standards for single-family residential dwellings of theUniform Building Codemost recently adopted by the International Conference of Building Officials. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

An ordinance of the governing body may require factory-built housing to comply with standards for safety which exceed the standards prescribed in subsection 1 if a single-family residential dwelling on the same lot is also required to comply with those standards. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The governing body shall adopt the same standards for development for the factory-built housing and the lot on which it is placed as those to which a conventional single-family residential dwelling on the same lot would be subject, including, but not limited to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Requirements for the setback of buildings. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Side and rear-yard requirements. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Standards for enclosures, access and the parking of vehicles. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Aesthetic requirements. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Requirements for minimum square footage. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Requirements for design, style and structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The governing body may prohibit the installation of factory-built housing in a specified area if: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

More than 6 years have elapsed between the date of manufacture of factory-built housing and the date of the application for the issuance of a permit to install factory-built housing in the affected area; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The area contains a building, structure or other object having a special character or special historical interest or value. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½factory-built housingï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 461.080. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section do not abrogate a recorded restrictive covenant.

section.heading: Manufactured homes: Inclusion in definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½; governing body to adopt standards for placement outside mobile home park; surrender of certificate of title of certain manufactured homes to Housing Division; limitations.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in this section, in an ordinance relating to the zoning of land adopted or amended by a governing body, the definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½ must include a manufactured home. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Notwithstanding the provisions of subsection 1, a governing body shall adopt standards for the placement of a manufactured home that will not be affixed to a lot within a mobile home park which require that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The manufactured home: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Have exterior siding and roofing which is similar in color, material and appearance to the exterior siding and roofing primarily used on other single-family residential dwellings in the immediate vicinity of the manufactured home, as established by the governing body; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Consist of one or more sections; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Consist of at least 400 square feet of living area unless the governing body, by administrative variance or other expedited procedure established by the governing body, approves a lesser amount of square footage based on the size or configuration of the lot or the square footage of single-family residential dwellings in the immediate vicinity of the manufactured home; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the manufactured home has an elevated foundation, the foundation is masked architecturally in a manner determined by the governing body. ï¿½The governing body of a local government in a county whose population is less than 52,000 may adopt standards that are less restrictive than the standards set forth in this subsection. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Standards adopted by a governing body pursuant to subsection 2 must be objective and documented clearly and must not be adopted to discourage or impede the construction or provision of affordable housing, including, without limitation, the use of manufactured homes for affordable housing. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Before a building department issues a permit to place a manufactured home on a lot pursuant to this section, other than a new manufactured home, the owner must surrender the certificate of title to the Housing Division of the Department of Business and Industry. The Division shall provide proof of such a surrender to the owner who must submit that proof to the building department. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The provisions of this section do not abrogate a recorded restrictive covenant prohibiting manufactured homes, nor do the provisions apply within the boundaries of a historic district established pursuant toNRS 384.005or384.100. An application to place a manufactured home on a residential lot pursuant to this section constitutes an attestation by the owner of the lot that the placement complies with all covenants, conditions and restrictions placed on the lot and that the lot is not located within a historic district. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Manufactured homeï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 489.113. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½New manufactured homeï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 489.125.

section.heading: Standards and specifications relating to school buildings in certain counties to be consistent and developed in conjunction with school district.

Developed in conjunction with the school district of that county.

section.heading: Obstruction of outdoor advertising structures by certain improvement projects: Required action by governing body; limitations on authorized actions; implementation and applicability of provisions.

content.p: If any improvement project is caused to be constructed for purposes of noise abatement by the governing body of a city or county within the right-of-way of a controlled-access freeway, which obstructs the visibility from the main-traveled way of the controlled-access freeway of an outdoor advertising structure that adjoins the controlled-access freeway, the governing body of the city or county shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Authorize, with the consent of the Department of Transportation pursuant tochapter 410of NRS and at no cost to the State or any local government, the owner of the outdoor advertising structure to adjust the height or angle of the structure to a height or angle that restores the visibility of the structure to the same or comparable visibility as before the construction of the improvement project; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Authorize, with the consent of the Department of Transportation pursuant tochapter 410of NRS and at no cost to the State or any local government, the owner of the outdoor advertising structure to relocate the structure to another location on the same parcel of land or on another parcel of land where the owner of the structure has secured the right to construct a structure pursuant to the applicable local ordinances in existence at that time and the relocation restores the visibility of the structure to the same or comparable visibility as before the construction of the improvement project; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Evaluate the impact of the improvement project on the visibility of the outdoor advertising structure and may, in its discretion, implement design modifications to the project which maintain the integrity of the project and which eliminate the effect of the project on the visibility of the structure so that adjustments to or relocation of the structure are not required to maintain its visibility; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Authorize, with the consent of the Department of Transportation pursuant tochapter 410of NRS and at no cost to the State or any local government, any other relief which is consistent with the public health, safety and welfare and which is mutually agreed upon by the governing body of the city or county, the Department of Transportation and the owner of the outdoor advertising structure; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the actions described in paragraphs
to
, inclusive, would not result in the same or comparable visibility of the structure, let the visibility of the structure remain obstructed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any action authorized pursuant to subsection 1 must comply with applicable federal and state statutes and regulations, agreements with the Federal Government or the State and, to the extent that their provisions do not conflict with this section, local ordinances governing the regulation of outdoor advertising structures. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of subsection 1 do not authorize the owner of an outdoor advertising structure to increase the size of the area of display of the structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A city or county may implement the provisions of this section by ordinance or by variance or waiver from applicable ordinance, rule or regulation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Are not intended to grant an express or implied right of light, air or view over a controlled-access freeway if such a right is not otherwise provided by law; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Do not apply to an outdoor advertising structure whose visibility was obstructed on or before June 6, 2005, by an improvement project for noise abatement; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Do not change the designation of an existing nonconforming outdoor advertising structure from nonconforming to conforming; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Do not authorize an increase in the number of nonconforming outdoor advertising structures. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Controlled-access freewayï¿½ means every highway to or from which owners or occupants of abutting lands and other persons are prohibited from having direct private access, and where access is allowed only at interchanges; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Outdoor advertising structureï¿½ means a billboard, subject to a permit issued by the Department of Transportation, that is designed, intended or used to disseminate commercial and noncommercial messages that do not concern the premises upon which the billboard is located.

section.heading: Nonconforming outdoor advertising structures: City or county to pay just compensation or authorize relocation if it requires removal or prohibits routine maintenance; exceptions; required removal of structure pursuant to amortization schedule prohibited; public hearing required in certain circumstances; appeal of amount of just compensation.

content.p: If a city or county, through the adoption, operation or enforcement of any ordinance or code, requires the removal of a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure, the city or county shall: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Pay just compensation for the loss of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure to the owner of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure and to the owner of the real property upon which the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure is located; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Authorize the owner of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure to relocate that structure to a site which is determined to be a comparable site by the owner of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure and which is approved by the city or county as an appropriate site for the structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If a city or county prohibits the owner of a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure from engaging in routine maintenance of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure, the city or county shall provide just compensation or authorize a comparable alternative location for the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure in the same manner as if the city or county had required the removal of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure pursuant to subsection 1. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A city or county shall not require the removal of a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure to occur pursuant to an amortization schedule, regardless of the length of the period set forth in the amortization schedule. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The requirements of subsection 1 do not apply to a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure that is: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Required to be removed as a result of the owner of the real property upon which the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure is located terminating the lease that governs the placement of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure on that property pursuant to the terms of that lease; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Destroyed or damaged in excess of 50 percent of its material structural value as a result of a natural disaster, including, without limitation, a fire, flood, earthquake, windstorm, rainstorm and snowstorm. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A city or county shall not require the removal of a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure as a condition to the development or redevelopment of the property upon which the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure is located without first holding a public hearing at which the owner of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure has an opportunity to be heard. The requirements of subsection 1 do not apply if, after the public hearing required by this subsection, a city or county requires the removal of the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If the owner of a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure or the owner of the real property upon which the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure is located disagrees with the amount of just compensation the city or county determines should be paid to the owner, the owner may appeal the determination to a court of competent jurisdiction. In determining the amount of just compensation that should be paid to an owner pursuant to subsection 1, the court shall consider: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The amount of income generated by the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The length of time remaining on any applicable term of a lease governing the nonconforming outdoor advertising structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Amortization scheduleï¿½ means an extended period over which a person is required to remove a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Just compensationï¿½ means the most probable price that a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure would bring in a competitive and open market under the conditions of a fair sale, without the price being affected by undue stimulus. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Material structural valueï¿½ means the cost of labor and materials necessary to erect an outdoor advertising structure. The term does not include any revenue or expenses related to the lease of real property upon which the outdoor advertising structure is located. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Nonconforming outdoor advertising structureï¿½ means an outdoor advertising structure which is constructed or erected in conformance with all applicable local ordinances and codes in effect on the date a building permit is issued for the outdoor advertising structure and which does not conform subsequently because of a change to the local ordinances or codes. The term does not include an outdoor advertising structure that is authorized by a special use permit, conditional use permit, variance, waiver, condition of zoning or other approval for the use of land if, when the special use permit, conditional use permit, variance, waiver, condition of zoning or other approval for the use of land was first approved, the special use permit, conditional use permit, variance, waiver, condition of zoning or other approval for the use of land was limited by a specific condition which allowed or required the governing body of the city or county to conduct a review of the structure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Outdoor advertising structureï¿½ means any sign, display, billboard or other device that is designed, intended or used to advertise or inform readers about services rendered or goods produced or sold on property other than the property upon which the sign, display, billboard or other device is erected. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Routine maintenanceï¿½ means normal repair and upkeep of the structural integrity and appearance of a nonconforming outdoor advertising structure. The term does not include any increase in the size or height of the structure or any addition or enhancement to the structure that increases the visual effect of the structure or increases the impact on the use of the land in the area around the structure.

section.heading: Restriction of adult motion picture theaters and bookstores: Declaration of legislative intent.

content.p: It is hereby declared a matter of legislative declaration and belief that the morals of the youth of the State of Nevada are threatened by the presence of adult motion picture theaters and adult bookstores which are appearing throughout some of the communities of our State. These establishments and the type and character of the merchandise and paraphernalia sold in them create an aura of mystery and enticement for Nevadaï¿½s youngsters that is increased by the lascivious and suggestive advertising that is often employed to promulgate the availability of these products and services. It is the intent of the Legislature to minimize the exposure of our youth to the influence of these establishments. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

It is further the firm belief that the moral values of our youth and therefore the mores of our society are in great part influenced and determined by the family, but are affected by the presence of an exposure to these establishments; therefore, it is the firm belief of the Legislature that society has a vital duty and role in the protection of our moral fiber and standards for the well-being of us all as a society. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The location of these establishments is of vital concern to society in regard to their location near areas where our youth may learn, play, pass by, or would be exposed to their advertising, window displays, or the general atmosphere encompassing their operation.

section.heading: Restriction of adult motion picture theaters and bookstores: Definitions.

content.p: ï¿½Adult motion picture theaterï¿½ means a motion picture theater whose program, during the time of its operation, contains one or more motion pictures which are rated ï¿½Xï¿½ by the Code Rating Administration of the Motion Picture Association of America, or are not rated, and whose program is intended to appeal to the prurient interests of the viewer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Adult bookstore,ï¿½ for the purposes of this chapter, means an establishment which merchandises printed material or movies which are intended to appeal to the prurient interests of the reader.

section.heading: Restriction of adult motion picture theaters and bookstores: Authority of commission and governing body.

content.p: A commission may recommend or a governing body may adopt zoning regulations restricting the construction, reconstruction, alteration, repair or use of buildings, structures or land as adult bookstores or adult motion picture theaters to specific districts within the geographical jurisdiction of the commission and governing body.

section.heading: Enactment of separate zoning and planning ordinances for specific parts of territories.

content.p: Where parts of the territory of any county or city lie within the jurisdiction of different regional planning commissions or other planning authorities, the governing body of such county or city may enact a separate building, subdivision, zoning or similar ordinance for each such part of its territory.

section.heading: Requirement to place street address or identifying number on exterior of certain buildings; notice of violation.

content.p: Each governing body shall require by ordinance that the owner of every: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Apartment complex place the number of its street address on the complex in such a manner that the police, fire department and other persons responding to an emergency can readily locate individual dwelling units within the complex. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Commercial shopping center place on the back door of each business in the shopping center, in numerals at least 3 inches high, a number identifying that business. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Building which is owned by or leased to the State or a political subdivision thereof and located within the jurisdiction of the governing body place the number of its street address on the front of the building in such a manner that the police, fire department and other persons responding to an emergency can readily locate the building. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Building which is used for commercial purposes place the number of its street address on the front of the building in such a manner that the police, fire department and other persons responding to an emergency can readily locate the building. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

If, during an inspection of a building, any member of a fire department becomes aware of a violation of an ordinance adopted pursuant to subsection 1, the chief officer of the fire department or an employee designated by the chief officer, shall give notice of the violation to the owner or occupant of the building. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

As used in this section, ï¿½apartment complexï¿½ means a building or group of buildings, each building of which is arranged in several suites of connecting rooms, each suite designed for independent housekeeping.

section.heading: Maintenance, reconstruction and repair of sidewalks: Circumstances under which governing body may compel action by owner of property.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, a governing body shall not require an owner of property to maintain, reconstruct or repair a sidewalk in a public right-of-way that abuts his or her property. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of subsection 1 do not prohibit a governing body from: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Imposing an assessment or other charge authorized by law for any reconstruction or repair of a sidewalk that the governing body causes to be performed within a public right-of-way; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Requiring an owner of property to maintain a sidewalk in a public right-of-way that abuts his or her property if the sidewalk was constructed pursuant to standards that exceed the general standards of the governing body for sidewalks; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Requiring, by ordinance, owners of property to be responsible for: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The repair and reconstruction of a sidewalk in the public right-of-way that abuts the property of the owner if the owner caused the need for such repair or reconstruction. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The general maintenance of a sidewalk in the public right-of-way that abuts the property of the owner, including, without limitation, sweeping, removal of snow, ice and weeds, and maintenance of any grass, shrubs or trees that encroach on the sidewalk.

section.heading: Inclusion of provisions for placement of recycling containers in plans for construction or major renovation of apartment complex or condominium.

content.p: On and after October 1, 2009, a governing body or its designee shall not approve any plan or revised plan for the construction or major renovation of an apartment complex or condominium unless the plan or revised plan includes provisions for the placement of recycling containers on the premises of the apartment complex or condominium. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Apartment complexï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 444A.0103. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Condominiumï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 117.010. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Major renovationï¿½ means the destruction or reconstruction of an apartment complex or condominium to an extent which exceeds 50 percent of the replacement value of the apartment complex or condominium.

section.heading: Governing body may not require dedication of real property as condition for issuance of building permit; exceptions.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, a governing body shall not require an owner of land to dedicate real property or any interest in real property as a condition for the issuance of a building permit. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The provisions of subsection 1 do not prohibit: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A governing body from requiring, before the issuance of a building permit, that an owner of land comply with any applicable conditions of a discretionary approval, including, without limitation, a special use permit, that has been granted previously; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The application of any requirements that a governing body imposes by ordinance with respect to a broad class of owners of land.

section.heading: Closure or conversion of mobile home park: Report required to be filed with planning commission or governing body.

content.p: Before a mobile home park is closed or converted to any other use, the person proposing the closure or conversion shall file with the appropriate planning commission or governing body a report containing information concerning the closure or conversion of the park. The report must address the availability of comparable parks in the area and the cost of relocating a mobile home to another park. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The planning commission or governing body shall make the report available for review by the general public.

section.heading: Conversion of existing mobile home park into individually owned lots: Restrictions governing body, commission or board may not impose as condition of approval.

content.p: Except as otherwise provided in subsection 2, may not require any change to existing densities, uses, lot sizes, setbacks or other similar restrictions applicable to the mobile home park as a condition of the approval of the conversion. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
May impose reasonable restrictions related to health and safety as a condition of the approval of the conversion.

section.heading: Application for matter relating to land use planning required to be complete for acceptance by governing body; review for completeness; procedure for return of incomplete application; submission of corrected application; preliminary application process.

content.p: Any application submitted to a governing body or its designee that concerns any matter relating to land use planning pursuant toNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, or any ordinance, resolution or regulation adopted pursuant thereto, may not be accepted by the governing body or its designee if the application is incomplete. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The governing body or its designee shall, within 10 working days after receiving an application of the type described in subsection 1: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Review the application for completeness; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Accept the application if the governing body or its designee finds that the application is complete or return the application if the governing body or its designee finds that the application is incomplete; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If the governing body or its designee returns the application: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Provide to the applicant a specific description of the additional information required; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Provide to the applicant a copy of the relevant provision of the ordinance, resolution or regulation which specifically requires the additional information or an explanation of why the additional information is necessary. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If a governing body or its designee fails to comply with the provisions of subsection 2, the application shall be deemed to be complete. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Once an applicant submits a corrected application in response to a notice of incompleteness provided pursuant to subsection 2, the governing body or its designee shall review and respond to the corrected application within 5 working days. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A governing body or its designee may establish a preliminary application process to help an applicant submit a complete application but shall not use any preliminary application process to circumvent the provisions of this section. Any preliminary application process established pursuant to this subsection must require a substantive meeting between an applicant and a governing body or its designee within 15 business days after the applicantï¿½s request. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Applicationï¿½ does not include an application for a building permit. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

ï¿½Designeeï¿½ means any division, department or agency of a governing body with jurisdiction over land use planning, improvement planning, permitting, inspection, zoning, roadways, utilities, public health, water, sewer, drainage, traffic control and public works.

section.heading: List of applications relating to land use planning required to be published on Internet website by governing body; monthly updates; required information.

content.p: A governing body shall publish on its Internet website a list of all applications relating to land use planning for residential housing pursuant toNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The list must be updated at least monthly and include, without limitation: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The date an application was initially filed; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The number of applications rejected for being incomplete; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other information that is relevant to determine whether applications relating to land use planning for residential housing are processed efficiently and expeditiously. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

As used in this section, ï¿½applicationï¿½ means any established application, including, without limitation, the preliminary application established pursuant to subsection 5 ofNRS 278.02327. The term does not include an application for a building permit.

section.heading: Actions against agency: Conditions and limitations.

content.p: Any person who has any right, title or interest in real property, and who has filed with the appropriate state or local agency an application for a permit which is required by statute or an ordinance, resolution or regulation adopted pursuant toNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, before that person may improve, convey or otherwise put that property to use, may bring an action against the agency to recover actual damages caused by: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any final action, decision or order of the agency which imposes requirements, limitations or conditions upon the use of the property in excess of those authorized by ordinances, resolutions or regulations adopted pursuant toNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, in effect on the date the application was filed, and which: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is arbitrary or capricious; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Is unlawful or exceeds lawful authority. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Any final action, decision or order of the agency imposing a tax, fee or other monetary charge that is not expressly authorized by statute or that is in excess of the amount expressly authorized by statute. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The failure of the agency to act on that application within the time for that action as limited by statute, ordinance or regulation. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
An action must not be brought under subsection 1: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Where the agency did not know, or reasonably could not have known, that its action, decision or order was unlawful or in excess of its authority. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Based on the invalidation of an ordinance, resolution or regulation in effect on the date the application for the permit was filed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Where a lawful action, decision or order of the agency is taken or made to prevent a condition which would constitute a threat to the health, safety, morals or general welfare of the community. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Where the applicant agrees in writing to extensions of time concerning his or her application. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Where the applicant agrees in writing or orally on the record during a hearing to the requirements, limitations or conditions imposed by the action, decision or order, unless the applicant expressly states in writing or orally on the record during the hearing that a requirement, limitation or condition is agreed to under protest and specifies which paragraph of subsection 1 provides cause for the protest. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For unintentional procedural or ministerial errors of the agency. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Unless all administrative remedies have been exhausted. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Against any individual member of the agency.

section.heading: Actions against agency: Commencement; memorandum of points and authorities; reply.

content.p: No action or proceeding may be commenced for the purpose of seeking judicial relief or review from or with respect to any final action, decision or order of any governing body, commission or board authorized byNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, unless the action or proceeding is commenced within 25 days after the date of filing of notice of the final action, decision or order with the clerk or secretary of the governing body, commission or board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A petitioner or cross-petitioner who is seeking judicial review must serve and file a memorandum of points and authorities within 40 days after an action is commenced. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The respondent or cross-petitioners shall serve and file a reply memorandum of points and authorities within 30 days after the service of the memorandum of points and authorities. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The petition or cross-petitioner may serve and file a reply memorandum of points and authorities within 30 days after service of the reply memorandum. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Within 7 days after the expiration of the time within which the petitioner is required to reply, any party may request a hearing. Unless a request for hearing has been filed, the matter shall be deemed submitted. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

All memoranda of points and authorities filed in proceedings involving petitions for judicial review must be in the form provided for appellate briefs inRule 28of the Nevada Rules of Appellate Procedure. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The court, for good cause, may extend the times allowed in this section for filing memoranda.

section.heading: Actions against agency: Defenses; attorneyï¿½s fees, court costs and interest; remedy cumulative.

content.p: It is a complete defense to any action brought underNRS 278.0233against a political subdivision of this State that the final action, decision or order complained of was required by federal or state law or by a regulation of a state agency which became effective after the date on which the application for a permit was filed. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The court may award reasonable attorneyï¿½s fees, court costs and interest to the prevailing party in an action brought underNRS 278.0233. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The remedy prescribed byNRS 278.0233is in addition to any other remedy provided by law.

section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: As used inNRS 278.02373to278.02377, inclusive, unless the context otherwise requires, the words and terms defined inNRS 278.02375,278.023757and278.02376have the meanings ascribed to them in those sections.

section.heading: ï¿½Halfway house for persons recovering from alcohol and other substance use disordersï¿½ defined.

content.p: [Replaced in revision byNRS 278.023757.]

section.heading: ï¿½Home for individual residential careï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Home for individual residential careï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 449.0105.

section.heading: ï¿½Recovery house for persons recovering from alcohol or other substance use disordersï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Recovery house for persons recovering from alcohol or other substance use disordersï¿½ means a residence that provides housing and a living environment for persons recovering from alcohol or other substance use disorders and is operated to facilitate their reintegration into the community but does not provide any treatment for alcohol or other substance use disorders. The term does not include a facility for transitional living for released offenders.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by2017, 2044; A2023, 1736)—(Substituted in revision for NRS 278.02374)

section.heading: ï¿½Residential facility for groupsï¿½ defined.

content.p: ï¿½Residential facility for groupsï¿½ has the meaning ascribed to it inNRS 449.017.

section.heading: Certain homes and facilities to be included in definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½ in city and county ordinances; exclusions.

content.p: In any ordinance adopted by a city or county, the definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½ must include, without limitation, a: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Residential facility for groups in which fewer than 11 unrelated persons with disabilities reside with: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
House parents or guardians who need not be related to any of the persons with disabilities; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
If applicable, additional persons who are related to the house parents or guardians within the third degree of consanguinity or affinity. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Home for individual residential care. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Recovery house for persons recovering from alcohol or other substance use disorders in which fewer than 11 persons reside. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The provisions of subsection 1 do not prohibit a definition of ï¿½single-family residenceï¿½ that allows more persons to reside in a residential facility for groups or the regulation of homes that are operated on a commercial basis. For the purposes of this subsection, a residential facility for groups, a recovery house for persons recovering from alcohol or other substance use disorders or a home for individual residential care shall not be deemed to be a home that is operated on a commercial basis for any purpose relating to zoning. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
As used in this section, ï¿½person with a disabilityï¿½ means a person: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
With a record of such an impairment; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Who is regarded as having such an impairment.

section.heading: Supremacy of limits upon development established by certain special legislative acts.

content.p: In the region of this State for which the Spring Mountains National Recreation Area Act and the Red Rock Canyon Conservation Area and Adjacent Lands Act establish limits upon development, the powers conferred by this chapter which relate to planning, subdivision regulation and zoning are subordinate to those limits.

section.heading: Powers of Nevada Tahoe Regional Planning Agency. [Effective upon the proclamation by the Governor of this State of the withdrawal by the State of California from the Tahoe Regional Planning Compact or of a finding by the Governor of this State that the Tahoe Regional Planning Agency has become unable to perform its duties or exercise its powers.]

content.p: In the region of this State for which there has been created byNRS 278.780to278.828, inclusive, a regional planning agency, the powers conferred byNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, upon any other authority are subordinate to the powers of such regional planning agency, and may be exercised only to the extent that their exercise does not conflict with any ordinance or plan adopted by such regional planning agency. The powers conferred byNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, shall be exercised whenever appropriate in furtherance of a plan adopted by the regional planning agency. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon the adoption by a regional planning agency created byNRS 278.780to278.828, inclusive, of any regional plan, any plan adopted pursuant toNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, shall cease to be effective as to the territory embraced in such regional plan. Each planning commission and governing body whose previously adopted plan is so affected shall, within 90 days after the effective date of the regional plan, initiate any necessary procedure to revise its plan and any related zoning ordinances which affect adjacent territory.

authorialNote.p: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ (Added to NRS by1969, 50; A1979, 1127, effective upon the proclamation by the Governor of this State of the withdrawal by the State of California from the Tahoe Regional Planning Compact or of a finding by the Governor of this State that the Tahoe Regional Planning Agency has become unable to perform its duties or exercise its powers; A2011, 3732,3739;2013, 2367,3217;2017, 1353)

section.heading: Powers of regional planning agency created by interstate compact.

content.p: In any region of this State for which there has been created by interstate compact a regional planning agency, the powers conferred byNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, are subordinate to the powers of such regional planning agency, and may be exercised only to the extent that their exercise does not conflict with any ordinance or plan adopted by such regional planning agency. The powers conferred byNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, shall be exercised whenever appropriate in furtherance of a plan adopted by the regional planning agency. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Upon the adoption by a regional planning agency created by interstate compact of any regional plan or interim plan, any plan adopted pursuant toNRS 278.010to278.630, inclusive, shall cease to be effective as to the territory embraced in such regional or interim plan. Each planning commission and governing body whose previously adopted plan is so affected shall, within 90 days after the effective date of the regional or interim plan, initiate any necessary procedure to revise its plan and any related zoning ordinances which affect adjacent territory.

section.heading: Applicability.

content.p: The provisions ofNRS 278.02507to278.02598, inclusive, apply only to counties whose population is 700,000 or more and cities located within those counties.

section.heading: Authority to establish regional planning coalition.

content.p: In a county whose population is 700,000 or more, the board of county commissioners and the city council of each of at least the three largest cities in the county may establish a regional planning coalition by cooperative agreement pursuant tochapter 277of NRS.

section.heading: Legislative intent.

content.p: The Legislature recognizes the need for innovative strategies of planning and development that: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Address the anticipated needs and demands of continued urbanization and the corresponding need to protect environmentally sensitive areas; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Will allow the development of less populous regions of this State if such regions: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Have sufficient resources of land and water to accommodate development in a manner that is environmentally sound. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Legislature further recognizes that innovative strategies of planning and development may be superior to conventional strategies of planning and development with respect to: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Protecting environmentally sensitive areas; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Maintaining the economic viability of agricultural and other predominantly rural land uses; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Providing cost-effective public facilities and services. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
It is the intent of the Legislature that each comprehensive regional policy plan adopted or amended pursuant to this chapter should set forth a process of planning which: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Allows for: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The efficient use of land within existing urban areas; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The conversion of rural lands to other uses, if such other uses are appropriate and consistent with the provisions of this chapter and the master plan of each affected city and county. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Uses innovative and flexible strategies of planning and development and creative techniques of land use planning which promote sustainable growth, including, without limitation, establishment of new towns, the maintenance of open space and mixed-use development. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
